results.title: Bully for hockey
results.creator_credit: Ivan Hexter, Peter Johnson, Film Australia and Moving Picture Company
results.brief_description: General interest film focusing on all age levels of men’s and women’s hockey within Doncaster Hockey Club. Includes training, fitness, social aspects. Suitable for secondary years 7-12.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ivan Hexter, Peter Johnson, Film Australia and Moving Picture Company

results.title: Bully [DVD] (D)
results.creator_credit: Larry Clark, Chris Hanley, Fernando Sulichin, Don Murphy and Studio Canal France
results.brief_description: Not one to shy from contentious content, Larry Clark followed the success and infamy of “Kids” (1995) and “Another day in paradise” (1997) with the equally controversial “Bully”, based on the true story of the trial of a group of Florida teenagers charged with murdering a friend. The film stars a cast barely out of their teens themselves (in fact, some still are): Brad Renfro, Rachel Miner, Bijou Phillips, Nick Stahl and Kelli Garner, a fact not lost on Clark in casting. High school drop out and keen surfer Marty (Renfro), and pal Bobby (Stahl), have been friends since age four and throughout that period Marty has been victimised physically and verbally by his so called best friend. Marty and Bobby invite Lisa and Ali out to a “party” and a sexual relationship develops between the four that is punctuated by violence and violation. Lisa discovers she is pregnant to Marty (or is it Bobby?), in love with him, and can no longer stand Bobby’s behaviour towards Marty, vowing to have him killed. Constructing a posse of misfit delinquents comprising a Mafia hitman, lovelorn games and acid addicted cousin, dope-smoker and suicidal young sexpot, head out to the everglades to complete the task. An exploitative expose of disenfranchised teens whose ennui and lack of parental guidance allow deviant behaviour and a loss of childhood innocence. Adapted from journalist Jim Schutze’s novel, “Bully: a true story of high school revenge”.

results.title: Bulls
results.brief_description: Adaptation of an Alan Marshall story of a young girl’s isolation on a remote dairy farm, set in the late 1930s. Atmospheric, this production adds another dimension to the Marshall piece, although it lacks the “Laurentian” dimension of “Boys and girls”.

results.title: Bullocky
results.creator_credit: Gil Brealey, Richard Mitchell and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Vic Deaves is a fourth generation bushman. For as long as he can remember, his family has lived in and off the Australian bush, often as timber-getters in the coastal valleys of New South Wales. Vic is a bullocky, one of the last of his kind. In this film Vic talks about his life and work, his bullocks and his friends. The area where he works is very much a part of another Australia, now past, but Vic and his surroundings represent the best of it.

results.title: Bullitt
results.creator_credit: Peter Yates, Philip D'Antoni and Solar Productions
results.brief_description: Steve McQueen plays the title role as Frank Bullitt, a no-glitter, all-guts cop who is assigned to protect Chicago gangster Johnny Ross (Pat Renella), who is scheduled to testify against his mob cronies in San Francisco. But after Ross is attacked and later killed at the hospital, Bullitt conceals Ross’s death and begins to investigate the case himself, sensing something suspicious. One of the most memorable scenes in Bullitt is the celebrated car chase through the streets of San Francisco. McQueen, an expert automobile and motorcycle racer, does his own stunt driving as he propels his high-performance Mustang around and over San Francisco’s fabled hills. Cast includes Jacqueline Bisset, Robert Vaughn, Don Gordon and Robert Duvall.

results.title: Bullfight
results.brief_description: Anna Sokolow recreates and reacts to a remembered bullfight and through her dancing recaptures her feelings while watching the fight. The climax is reached when the dancer identifies with the bullfighter, the bull and the death in the ring.

results.title: Bullets over Broadway
results.creator_credit: Woody Allen, Robert Greenhut, Sweetland Films BV and Magnolia Productions
results.brief_description: A struggling writer gets the opportunity of his life to stage his latest play on Broadway. There is one catch however: he must cast the untalented mistress of a notorious gangster in the lead role. Overwhelmed by the chance of success, he overlooks critical factors looming in the wings, including a player who can’t act, a leading lady wanting to steal the spotlight, a leading man who is a compulsive eater and the gangster’s bodygaurd who wants to rewrite the play. Set in the 1920’s, Woody Allen’s film is enhanced by an excellent atmospheric soundtrack. The cast includes John Cusack, Mary-Louise Parker, Jennifer Tilly, Tracey Ullman, and Academy Award winner Dianne Wiest.

results.title: Bullet in the head
results.creator_credit: John Woo, John Woo Film Productions and Golden Princess Film Production Ltd
results.brief_description: Set during the Vietnam war and focusing on the lives of three life-long friends, this film has been described as an ‘Eastern Deer Hunter’. In 1967 the three young men, fugitives from the Hong Kong police, set up a black-market operation in war-torn Saigon. Almost immediately after their arrival they run into trouble and forced to flee Saigon when they are captured by the Vietcong and taken to a prisoner-of-war camp. Thrown together in extreme conditions, they turn on each other as lust, betrayal and greed threaten to shatter their closeness. Made in the year following the Tiannamen Square Massacre, the film focuses on the strain that relationships undergo in times of strife, and the brutality of the war in Vietnam. Named by Woo as his personal favorite, it features his trademark combination of ballistic gun action and pathos around the theme of homosocial bonding. Cast includes Tony Leung, Jacky Cheung and Simon Yam. In Cantonese with English subtitles.

results.title: Bull Durham
results.creator_credit: Ron Shelton, Mark Burg, Thom Mount and Mount Company
results.brief_description: Kevin Costner, Susan Sarandon and Tim Robbins turn in seriously sexy performances in this sensational baseball comedy. Charged with pulling the Durham Bulls ou of the longest losing streak in Carolina’s Baseball League history, Crash Davis’ (Costner) main challenge is to instruct, insult and inspire Eddie ‘Nuke’ Calvin (Robbins), their indisciplined but bullet-fast pitcher. Sarandon is the team’s groupie-cum-English Lit teacher who becomes the fly in the ointment after she catches Nuke’s eye and begins to distract him from Crash’s tuition with her own slightly bizarre set of off-field rules.
